page.title: 14CORNISH HEDGEROWS
page.content: THROUGHOUT THE SEASONS OF THE YEAR, ONE OF THE MOST STRIKING ASPECTS OF THE AREA IS THE HEDGEROWS. THIS IS DUE TO THE COUNCIL POLICY OF CUTTING THE HEDGES ONLY ONCE DURING THE YEAR AND THE LIMITED USE OF CHEMICAL SPRAYS. IN {SPRING,}PRIMROSES AND DAFFODILS ARE FOUND IN ABUNDANCE ALONG WITH STITCHWORT AND CELANDINES. BLUEBELLS, VIOLETS AND RED CAMPION FOLLOW IN PROFUSION.{SUMMER}SEES FOXGLOVES, SCABIOUS, ROSE-BAY WILLOW-HERB, VETCH AND NUMEROUS OTHER WILD FLOWERS COLOURING THE HEDGEROWS.{AUTUMN}BRINGS DIFFERENT COLOURS TO THE HEDGES WITH THE CHANGING LEAVES AND THE BLACK- BERRIES, ELDERBERRIES, SLOES, HIPS AND HAWS WHICH PROVIDE ADEQUATE FOOD FOR THE BIRDS, INSECTS AND SMALL MAMMALS. IN{WINTER}THE HEDGES ARE BARE EXCEPT FOR THE EVERGREEN IVY AND HOLLY AND THEIR GRANITE STRUCTURE CAN BE SEEN.
